content.description:
Support Your Local Gravity is a complete traverse that climbs good rock over a perfect landing.

Stand start with hands matched on the shelf (this shares the start with

Significant Minor

) six feet off the ground. From there, traverse right (crux) along the shelf using an assortment of edges, stick a big right hand upon reaching the dihedral, then continue straight up, and top it out using the bumps.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is spectacular.
content.location: It ascends the west face of Pillbox Boulder.

content.description:
Stand start with hands matched on the obvious horizontal shelf about six feet off the ground. From there, dyno to one of the many bumps, follow with the left (crux), bring the feet up to the start hold, reach a hand to the lip, and top it out.

More or less the same as Atop The Under. But may as well if you're there.

I trundled several loose holds at the top, but there are still some questionable ones remaining. Just be cognizant of this while topping out.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, the landing is very good though.
content.location:
It ascends the far north side of the boulder's west face. It climbs just to the left of

Atop the Under

.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand gaston. From there, move right to a rail, walk the feet over, reach the next rail, move up and left to a pair of thin edges, then hit the lip, bring the feet up, reach the rail and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is very good, but there are a few minor rocks behind the problem.
content.location: It ascends the southern end of the west face of Pillbox.

content.description:
Stand start with a good, left hand edge and a sloping right hand edge. From there, dyno to the false lip (crux), follow suit with the other hand, get a high foot and finish it off.

More or less the same as Significant Minor. But may as well if you're there.

I trundled several loose holds at the top, but there are still some questionable ones remaining. Just be cognizant of this while topping out.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, there is a very good landing for this problem.
content.location:
It ascends the west face of Pillbox Boulder. It climbs just to the right of

Significant Minor

(the start hold is about two feet to the right).
